name: GIFT CERTIFICATE
description: Buy one or more to of these to give to a friend or loved one as a special treat. They can be used towards any of our fun seasonal floral design workshops or for membership in our Flower CSA. The gift certificate is a great option if you're looking for a holiday gift during the winter when our farm does not have actual flower available. The flower lover in your life will decidedly look forward to visiting our farm and receiving our organically-grown flowers during the warmer months ahead. Buy multiples to combine into one larger gift certificate as desired. Our workshops generally cost between $150-$250, depending on the topic, materials, and length of the class. Membership in the CSA ranges from $120-450, depending on the number of weeks the member will be getting flowers. We are happy to send a beautiful letterpress card to the gift recipient along with a note explaining your generous gift. We can also send a beautiful digital card if quick delivery is required for a last minute occasion. Please provide the gift recipients full name and mailing address during check-out or email us specific instructions at info@lovenfreshflowers.com. ** Please note: we do not ship flowers. Only purchase a gift certificate if your recipient lives in the Philadelphia area or is willing to travel here for a workshop. **

name: csa spring PLANT share
description: This CSA share is a one time pick-up of 30 organically grown plants to fill your own cutting garden at home. Plants come in a deep cell tray that ensures a large and healthy root ball. The mix of plants consists of approximately 75% annual varieties and 25% perennial and biennial varieties. IF CARED FOR PROPERLY, THESE PLANTS WILL PRODUCE ENOUGH FLOWERS TO KEEP YOUR HOME FILLED WITH BOUQUETS ALL SEASON. All plants are grown from seed by Love 'n Fresh Flowers in our greenhouse using only organic practices so that they are robust and ready to go right into your planting beds. The exact mix of plants in this share will be determined in February, but all will be good for sun/part-sun and average soil conditions. All make excellent cut flowers and foliage for your own backyard bouquets. ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ The following are some possible plants in the share. Shares may not be identical. There is no cut flower quite like the lisianthus (Eustoma grandiflorum). A lover of full sun and hot weather, it happily flowers through the dog days of August and into the fall. The flowers last several weeks in the vase and just a few stems can make a big bouquet. Euphorbia marginata 'Icicle' is another must-have in the cutting garden. The icy white edges of its leaves make an elegant and dramatic foliage filler in bouquets. Ammi majus goes by the common name False Queen Anne's Lace, but it's anything but true bliss in bouquets. The lacey heads full of millions of teeny tiny white flowers instantly inject any arrangement with a romantic dreamy quality. A much loved bloom in days gone by, Sweet Williams ( Dianthus barbatus) are regaining popularity as a cut flower due to their longevity in the vase...up to 20 days when picked at the right stage! Fresh cut snapdragons (Antirrhinum majus) are always a marvel for their beautiful and abundant spikes of delicate colors and the honeyed fragrance (yes, fragrance!) that each blossom exudes. Black-eyed Susan (Rudbeckia) is an instant reminder of the relaxed summer days of childhood and picking wildflowers along the road. Varities for cutting have tall stems and add cheerful charm to bouquets. Joe Pye Weed (Eupatorium) is a real delight, both in the garden and in the vase. It attracts hordes of butterflies while outside and loads of admirers inside. A very long lasting cut flower that adds delicate lavender notes to arrangements. ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ Plants come in a deep cell tray, the perfect size for planting straight into the garden. Since we are growing these plants for you from seed or cuttings that may not produce as planned, Love 'n Fresh reserves the right to substitute varieties as needed. All plants are grown using organic fertilizers and sustainable practices. Shipping is not available. Plants will be available for pick up at the Love 'n Fresh design studio in Chestnut Hill and a private home in West Philly in late April when the spring weather becomes stable enough for planting in the garden. You will receive an email with the pick up details in mid-April once we see how the spring weather is unfolding. If you have any questions before ordering, please email info@lovenfreshflowers.com. We're happy to help!

name: csa BOUQUET share ~ 14 Weeks
description: CSA stands for Community Supported Agriculture. A flower CSA works the same way as popular vegetable CSAs. A member typically joins in the winter/early spring before the growing season starts. Their payment helps our farm buy seeds and other supplies for the year. In return for their investment, members receive a weekly bouquet of premium organically-grown flowers at a far better price than if purchased at retail. When you join Love ‘n Fresh Flowers' CSA, you’ll be getting only blooms that have been grown without any synthetic chemicals in a field where nurturing nature through biodiversity and sustainable practices is top priority. We grow our flowers right here in Philly (in the Roxborough/Andorra neighborhood), and they are usually picked the same morning as members get their share! This is in stark contrast to the half-dead flowers at the supermarket that have been shipped in from South America and were picked several weeks earlier. How It Works Place your order here for the share type and length of your choice. Please look at all the choices in the store to make sure you are selecting the one you want. Once we receive your order, we will then get in touch with you via email (within 48 hours) to confirm the following information: - Start Date: You may choose to have this share start the first week of June or July. - Pick Up Location: Pick up will be at our design studio in Chestnut Hill (zip 19118). We may also have another pick-up location in West Philly, but that is not confirmed yet. If you are interested in the West Philly location, please email us first to indicate interest in that location (we need five people to make it a go). - Pick Up Day and Time: The pick-up for Chestnut Hill is on Tuesdays each week between 4:30 PM and 7:00 PM. - Gift Card: If you are giving a CSA share as a gift, we can provide a lovely card explaining your thoughtful and unique gift. Let us know if you would prefer a paper or electronic card and where to send it. ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ Bouquet shares are lush, pre-arranged, exquisite, European-style, hand-tied designs that come wrapped in a hand-stamped brown paper wrap for easy transport and gift giving. The bouquet share is a great choice for the local business looking to add color and a fresh distinctive touch to your sales or reception area. ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ You can share your share!! Since our flowers last so long, sometimes you don't need a new batch every week or you might be going on vacation during the summer. You can absolutely have someone else pick up your share whenever you like. Consider splitting it with a friend where you alternate weeks. SIGN UP BY DECEMBER 31st AND RECEIVE AN EXTRA WEEK FREE! Member Benefits - The most beautiful, high quality, organic fresh flowers grown right here in Philadelphia - A great value: the more weeks you sign up for, the bigger your savings - A 15% discount off any Love ‘n Fresh floral design workshops for the season - Regular e-newsletters with tips and ideas for your flowers - Invitations to special member events Past Members Said "Would definitely do this again next year. I received many compliments for my flowers from family and friends. It was lovely having fresh flowers throughout the house. I just purchased a new kitchen table and could not wait until it was delivered to put my flowers on the table. Cannot wait until next year!" "Each week there were a few flowers that took my breath away. This week it was apricot colored zinnias and a heavenly blue flower I don't know the name of. I put them together and the result was stunning! what I enjoyed most about my experience was the exposure to so many new flowers and realizing as the summer went on that I love flowers now even more than I did before!" "I couldn't grow my own flowers this year, and I was so happy to get Jennie's buckets every week of great, fresh flowers. They are much more pleasant to work with than flowers from the store."
